title: D.1.1.1 - Ensure a separate partition for containers has been created
description:
D.1.1.1 (docker), Level 1:
Ensure a separate partition for containers has been created
Audit: PASS
Mitigation:
For new installations, you should create a separate partition for the /var/lib/docker mount point. For systems that have already been installed, you should use the Logical Volume Manager (LVM) within Linux to create a new partition.
mitigation: For new installations, you should create a separate partition for the /var/lib/docker mount point. For systems that have already been installed, you should use the Logical Volume Manager (LVM) within Linux to create a new partition.

title: D.1.1.11 - Ensure auditing is configured for Dockerfiles and directories - /etc/docker/daemon.json
description:
D.1.1.11 (docker), Level 1:
Ensure auditing is configured for Dockerfiles and directories - /etc/docker/daemon.json
Audit: WARN
Mitigation:
Install auditd. Add -w /etc/docker/daemon.json -k docker to the /etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules file. Then restart the audit daemon using command service auditd restart.
Tags:
GDPR
HIPAA
NIST
mitigation: Install auditd. Add -w /etc/docker/daemon.json -k docker to the /etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules file. Then restart the audit daemon using command service auditd restart.

title: D.1.2.2 - Ensure that the version of Docker is up to date - Using 20.10.11, verify is it up to date as deemed necessary
description:
D.1.2.2 (docker), Level 1:
Ensure that the version of Docker is up to date - Using 20.10.11, verify is it up to date as deemed necessary
Audit: PASS
Mitigation:
You should monitor versions of Docker releases and make sure your software is updated as required.
Messages:
Using 20.10.11, verify is it up to date as deemed necessary
mitigation: You should monitor versions of Docker releases and make sure your software is updated as required.

title: D.2.10 - Ensure the default cgroup usage has been confirmed
description:
D.2.10 (docker), Level 2:
Ensure the default cgroup usage has been confirmed
Audit: PASS
Mitigation:

title: K.4.1.3 - Ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
description:
K.4.1.3 (kubernetes), Level 1:
Ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
Audit: PASS
Mitigation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example, chmod 644 <proxy kubeconfig file
Tags:
GDPR
HIPAA
NIST
PCI
mitigation: Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example, chmod 644 <proxy kubeconfig file

title: K.4.1.8 - Ensure that the client certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root - client-ca-file: /etc/kubernetes/ssl/kube-ca.pem
description:
K.4.1.8 (kubernetes), Level 1:
Ensure that the client certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root - client-ca-file: /etc/kubernetes/ssl/kube-ca.pem
Audit: PASS
Mitigation:
Run the following command to modify the ownership of the --client-ca-file. chown root:root <filename>
Tags:
GDPR
HIPAA
NIST
PCI
Messages:
client-ca-file: /etc/kubernetes/ssl/kube-ca.pem
mitigation: Run the following command to modify the ownership of the --client-ca-file. chown root:root <filename>
